Name: Naming of one thoroughfare and public place, Jean-Jacques Dessalines Boulevard, Brooklyn.
Title: A Local Law in relation to the naming of one thoroughfare and public place, Jean-Jacques Dessalines Boulevard in the Borough of Brooklyn.

History.Action: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
History.Description: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
A motion was made that this Introduction be P-C Item Approved by Comm approved by Roll Call.
This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor

Attachments.Name: August 8, 2018 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - August 8, 2018
Legislative Documents - Letter to the Mayor

Summary: This bill would co-name one thoroughfare and public place, based on requests of Council Members whose district includes the location.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      Section 1. The following street name, in the Borough of Brooklyn, is hereby designated as hereafter indicated.

New Name
Present Name
Limits
Jean-Jacques Dessalines Boulevard
Rogers Avenue
Between Farragut Road and Eastern Parkway


      ï¿½2. This local law shall take effect immediately.





PM
LS# 6770 and 6437
7/25/18 10:38AM
